Unfortunately, while Amazon does share a deals list in advance with shopping reporters and select partners, the full deals list is not available to the public in advance.Here at Mashable, we work hard to provide our readers with the best possible deals — and at the best possible time. So, while we can't give away specific deals in advance, we try to point you in the right direction. When we suspect a product will get further price drops, or if it's available at a lower price elsewhere, we'll note this in our coverage.Lastly, Amazon has provided some information on what types of deals to expect. According to an Amazon blog post, you can expect the following deals during Prime Day 2025:Tech deals:Save up to 40% on TVs from Samsung, Sony, LG, and HisenseSave up to 40% on select Anker chargersSave up to 40% on select Samsung Chromebooks and 35% on select Samsung tabletsSave up to 30% on select gaming laptops and PCsAmazon devices:Save 36% to 45% on Echo devices Save up to 25% on the Kindle and the Kindle Paperwhite Signature EditionFind savings on Amazon device bundles, including Echo speakers, Blink cameras, and Kindle bundlesSave up to 56% on Amazon Fire tabletsSave up to 50% on Fire TV SticksSave up to 32% on Fire TVsGrooming and beauty deals:Save up to 40% on products from Philips Sonicare and WaterpikSave as much as 30% on premium skin care from brands like Kiehl’s 8:12 pm ET | July 8, 2025 When does Prime Day start? Prime Day starts promptly at 12:00 a.m. PT on Tuesday, July 8. If you are also math challenged, and also on the east coast, that's 3 a.m. ET on Tuesday. The sale will run through 12:00 a.m. PT on Friday, July 11.That said, Amazon traditionally releases early deals on its own devices starting about a week in advance of the official Prime start time, as do many other brands. That means you can already shop tons of early Prime Day deals.In our coverage, we'll note if we expect a product to get additional price drops as the sale progresses. But, in general, if you see a product you like at a good price, don't wait too long — it could always sell out or the deal could end.

Live

Updated at 9:13 pm ET July 9, 2025

It's official: Prime Day 2025 is live. And this time, instead of 48 hours of non-stop shopping action, you have 96 hours to smash that "Add To Cart" button and put Amazon's free return policy to the test.

That's right, two days of deals just weren't enough for Amazon. In 2025, Amazon's signature sale is back for four whole days of marathon shopping. Prime Day 2025 runs from Tuesday, July 8 to Friday, July 11, and we'll be providing live updates from start to finish.

The Mashable team is fully caffeinated and ready to bring you all of the top deals, the latest Prime Day news, details on competitor sales, and stock alerts. From record-low prices on flagship products from Amazon, Sony, and Samsung, to under-the-radar finds from our tech reporters, you'll find the biggest highlights of the sale right here.

The Latest

10 minutes ago | July 10, 2025

Add body composition metrics to your health tracking

The popular Renpho smart scale measures 13 body measurements, including weight, muscle mass, and metabolic age. It's on sale for only $20 this Prime Day.

39 minutes ago | July 10, 2025

Add an extra layer of security to your vehicle with a front and rear dash cam. The Vantrue E2 dash cam is on sale for $149.59, which is a savings of 32%.

1 hour ago | July 9, 2025

Shop household essentials under $25

Prime Day is one of my favorite times to stock up on stuff I was going to buy anyway. I always buy cleaning supplies and other household essentials during the sales event — because if I'm going to spend my money on boring necessities, I'm going to make sure I get a little discount. Right now, you can save up to 30% on everyday essentials like dish soap, laundry detergent, trash bags, surface cleaners, and more at Amazon.

2 hours ago | July 9, 2025

Just dropping in to say that these are some of the best Prime Day deals live now

4 hours ago | July 9, 2025

This is not a drill: Yankee Candles are half off

Every Prime Day and Black Friday, I wait to see if Yankee Candles are going to go on sale, and I'm always thrilled when they do. Sometimes, they sell out within an hour, so I'm very glad to report that there are still some Yankee Candles on sale on day two of Prime Day. I personally picked up my all-time favorite scent, Pink Sands.

5 hours ago | July 9, 2025

Best deals under $50

We know, not everyone is looking to splurge on $500 worth of tech on Prime Day. There are some genuinely good deals for less than $50 worth checking out on day two:

5 hours ago | July 9, 2025

Shark has a bonkers deal on the CryoGlow LED mask and FlexFusion hair dryer

We've found a genuinely jaw-dropping Prime Day deal that lets you bundle the Shark CryoGlow LED face mask and the Shark FlexFusion hair dryer for $499.99. Buying them separately at full price would cost you $699.98, so this is a great deal on two products that our beauty reviewers love.

10 hours ago | July 9, 2025

The price on this LG laptop has dropped even lower

One thing we love about a week-long Prime Day? When deals just keep getting better.

This LG laptop has a new Intel Core Ultra Series 2 processor and a healthy amount of ram/storage. And as of day two, its price has dropped by another $15, even beating LG's own price by $15.

Here's what our readers have been loving:

12 hours ago | July 9, 2025

Top tech deals for Prime Day, day two

On the second day of Prime Day, Mashable Tech Editor Timothy Beck Werth has picked out some new top tech deals. Highlights include popular gadgets from Samsung and Beats.

13 hours ago | July 9, 2025

AirPods 4 vs. Airpods Pro 2: Which Prime Day deal should you buy?

Prime Day 2025 has delivered discounts on Apple AirPods 4 ($99) and Apple AirPods Pro 2 ($149). According to camelcamelcamel, that's the lowest-ever price for the Apple AirPods 4. And the same goes for the Apple AirPods Pro 2. So how are you supposed to pick?

In our roundup of the best AirPods to buy, Mashable's Apple expert Bethany Allard writes that the Apple Airpods Pro 2 offer "well-rounded sound, impressive active noise cancellation, plenty of portability, and a price that (if you catch it at the right time) doesn't exceed $200." Well that time has come, folks.

We asked Bethany Allard to compare these Prime Day deals: "The short version of this matchup: if you want active noise cancellation, grab the AirPods Pro. The longer version: the AirPods Pro drop down less frequently than the AirPods 4, making it a better deal to grab when you spot it. They’re also an all around better pair of earbuds, with ANC, four sizes of silicone ear tips for a more secure fit, and an additional hour of listening time per charge (even with ANC). If you’re between these two deals, I recommend going with the Pros."

13 hours ago | July 9, 2025

The Apple AirTag is now under $20 on Prime Day — less than $1 off its record-low price

We weren't sure what to expect from Prime Day, but when it comes to Apple deals, it has been amazing. We've been treated to record-low prices on AirPods, MacBooks, Apple Watches, and so much more. And to keep all of these discounted items safe and secure, you should consider an Apple AirTag.

As of July 9, the Apple AirTag is on sale for $19.99 on Prime Day. That's 31% off the list price, and less than $1 off the record-low price. And if you want to pick up more than one AirTag at a heavily discounted rate, the four-pack of Apple AirTags is $64.99 for Prime Day. That works out at less than $17 per Airtag.

14 hours ago | July 9, 2025

The Samsung Galaxy Watch 7 has hit a new low price on the second day of Prime Day 2025

We didn't think it could get any better, but then it did.

On the first day of Prime Day, the Samsung Galaxy Watch 7 was listed for $199.99. That was the lowest price we had ever seen at Amazon, but not anymore. As of July 9, The Samsung Galaxy Watch 7 is on sale for a record-low price of $189.99 this Prime Day, down from $329.99.

It's almost like a new model is being prepared for launch. We don't know whether or not a new edition is set for release, but Samsung Galaxy Unpacked is taking place on July 9. You be the judge.

16 hours ago | July 9, 2025

Meta Quest 3S bundle with Gorilla Tag swings in at under $250

Here's a Prime Day deal that will send VR fans bananas: A king kong-sized discount on the 128GB Meta Quest 3S, which comes with Gorilla Tag plus a three-month trial of Meta Horizon+. It's a whole lotta fun at the lowest-ever price for this particular bundle.

The 128GB Meta Quest 3S + Gorilla Tag combo is now just $249 — a 17% discount on the usual list price of $299.99. That's an overall saving of $50.

Our favorite Prime Day MacBook Air deal is somehow still available

As of July 9, the latest in the MacBook Air range is on sale for $849 at Amazon. The discount applies to all colors, so you can choose from starlight, midnight, silver, and sky blue.

8:13 pm ET | July 9, 2025

The 55-inch Hisense CanvasTV is less than $700 right now

Our favorite Samsung The Frame dupe, the Hisense CanvasTV, got a really sweet discount for Prime Day. Normally $999.99, the 55-inch 4K TV is on sale for $688.99. It's a relatively budget-friendly art TV with a user-friendly Google TV interface.

When does Prime Day start?

Prime Day starts promptly at 12:00 a.m. PT on Tuesday, July 8. If you are also math challenged, and also on the east coast, that's 3 a.m. ET on Tuesday. The sale will run through 12:00 a.m. PT on Friday, July 11.

That said, Amazon traditionally releases early deals on its own devices starting about a week in advance of the official Prime start time, as do many other brands. That means you can already shop tons of early Prime Day deals.

In our coverage, we'll note if we expect a product to get additional price drops as the sale progresses. But, in general, if you see a product you like at a good price, don't wait too long — it could always sell out or the deal could end.
